I'd highly recommend "Elizabeth" (1998) for you. This film offers a compelling portrayal of Elizabeth I's early years and her journey to become a strong monarch. Fanny Ardant, Eric Cantona, and John Gielgud deliver captivating performances that make this historical drama truly engaging.

Additionally, "Man on Wire" (2008) is another interesting choice. It tells the story of Philippe Petit's daring high-wire walk between the Twin Towers in 1974, an event considered one of the greatest feats in artistic criminality. The film features Jean-Louis Blondeau and Paul McGill, who play key roles in recounting this extraordinary tale. Both movies might appeal to your preference for exploring what lies beneath the surface of a story.
